name: **Turbot Island – _Tairbeart_**
description: Turbot Island – Tairbeart L580-524 Sheet 37 Evacuated in 1978. Nowadays the increasing number of houses are summer homes. Land on a sandy beach, just E of the sheltered slip, in a bay on the E end of the N side. There is attractive and convenient camping on machair in the dunes behind the beach. There is water in a well. A road running E to W bisects the island. Two Corncrake sang in 2003. At least 3 were heard in 2007, but there was a rumour of a 4th. 5 birds were calling in 2010, when a mink was causing concern to conservators. At least one was calling 2014.
